net.novazero.lib.ikbus.io

Class InputStreamIKBusPacketReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.novazero.lib.ikbus.io.InputStreamIKBusPacketReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, IKBusPacketReader

    public class InputStreamIKBusPacketReader
extends Object
implements IKBusPacketReader
    An I/K-bus packet reader that reads and parses its data from an input stream. The input stream is assumed to provide live data and thus the reader incorporates detection of errors due to timeouts.
    Author:
    Daan Scheerens

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int PACKET_TIMEOUT
      The timeout period in milliseconds for reading packets.

      InputStreamIKBusPacketReader(InputStream inputStream)
      Creates a new I/K-bus packet reader that uses the specified input stream as its data source.

      Closes the I/K-bus packet reader and releases any system resources that were allocated.

    • Field Detail

      • PACKET_TIMEOUT

        public static final int PACKET_TIMEOUT
        The timeout period in milliseconds for reading packets. A packet is considered incomplete when having to wait longer than this period for the next byte to be received.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputStreamIKBusPacketReader

        public InputStreamIKBusPacketReader(InputStream inputStream)
        Creates a new I/K-bus packet reader that uses the specified input stream as its data source.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The input stream from which the packet data is to be read.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public IKBusPacketStreamElement read()
                              throws IKBusIOException
        Attempts to read an I/K-bus packet from the stream. The packet is wrapped in an IKBusPacketStreamElement instance. This allows this method to return the data of both valid and corrupted packets, since corrupted packets cannot be represented by an IKBusPacket instance. Corrupted packets may occur due to noise or contention on the bus. If the end of the stream has been reached this method will return null.
        Specified by:
        read in interface IKBusPacketReader
        Returns:
        An IKBusPacketStreamElement instance that represents the I/K-bus packet that was read (which may be corrupted) or null if the end of the stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        IKBusIOException - If there was an I/O exception while reading the packet from the underlying stream.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IKBusIOException
        Closes the I/K-bus packet reader and releases any system resources that were allocated. After the stream has been closed calling the read() method will result in an exception.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface IKBusPacketReader
        Throws:
        IKBusIOException - If there was an I/O exception while closing the underlying data source or if the reader has already been closed.
